{{Noble House infobox | name=House of Finwë | image = J.R.R. Tolkien - Finwë heraldic device (I).jpg | caption= | othernames= | founder=[[Finwë]] | leader=[[King of the Noldor]] | location=[[Tirion]], [[Formenos]] | affiliation= | rivalry= | destroyed= | language=[[Quenya]] | members= | race=[[Noldor]] | distinctions= | height= | hair= | skin= | clothing= | weapons= | heirlooms= | gallery=the House of Finwë }} The '''House of Finwë''' was a large [[Noldor]]in royal house founded by [[Finwë]], [[King of the Noldor]]. Its device was that of a great golden sun, even though Finwë was slain before the [[Sun]] was made. The House of Finwë had three main branches, one for each of Finwë's sons: the [[House of Fëanor]], the [[House of Fingolfin]] and the [[House of Finarfin]]. ===Lineage=== Finwë had two wives. His first was [[Míriel]], who passed away soon after bearing their only child, [[Fëanor]]. His second wife was [[Indis]], of the [[Vanyar]], who bore him two sons: [[Fingolfin]] and [[Finarfin]], and two daughters: [[Findis]] and [[Írimë]].

==Other versions of the legendarium== Finwë's two daughters don't appear in the published ''[[Silmarillion]]''. In earlier versions of the legendarium, Finwë and Indis had three daughters: '''Findis''', '''Faniel''' and '''Finvain'''. It remains unclear if the third daughter survived in the final conception of Finwë's family tree.{{PM|Shibboleth}}, note 26 {{references}} [[Category:Elven noble houses]] [[Category:House of Finwë| ]]
